verses.verse: And when Balaam <WH1109> saw <WH7200> that it pleased <WH2895> the LORD <WH3068> to bless <WH1288> Israel, <WH3478> he went <WH1980> not, as at other times, <WH6471> to seek <WH7125> for enchantments, <WH5172> but he set <WH7896> his face <WH6440> toward <WH413> the wilderness. <WH4057>

And Balaam <WH1109> lifted <WH5375> up his eyes, <WH5869> and he saw <WH7200> Israel <WH3478> abiding <WH7931> in his tents according to their tribes; <WH7626> and the spirit <WH7307> of God <WH430> came <WH1961> on him.

And he took <WH5375> up his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559> Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> has said, <WH5002> and the man <WH1397> whose eyes <WH5869> are open <WH8365> has said: <WH5002>

He has said, <WH5002> which <WH834> heard <WH8085> the words <WH561> of God, <WH410> which saw <WH2372> the vision <WH4236> of the Almighty, <WH7706> falling <WH5307> into a trance, but having his eyes <WH5869> open: <WH1540>
How <WH4100> goodly <WH2896> are your tents, <WH168> O Jacob, <WH3290> and your tabernacles, <WH4908> O Israel! <WH3478>

As the valleys <WH5158> are they spread <WH5186> forth, as gardens <WH1593> by the river's <WH5104> side, as the trees of lign aloes <WH174> which the LORD <WH3068> has planted, <WH5193> and as cedar <WH730> trees beside <WH5921> the waters. <WH4325>

He shall pour <WH5140> the water <WH4325> out of his buckets, <WH1805> and his seed <WH2233> shall be in many <WH7227> waters, <WH4325> and his king <WH4428> shall be higher <WH7311> than Agag, <WH90> and his kingdom <WH4438> shall be exalted. <WH5375>

God <WH410> brought <WH3318> him forth <WH4161> out of Egypt; <WH4714> he has as it were the strength <WH8443> of an unicorn: <WH7214> he shall eat <WH398> up the nations <WH1471> his enemies, <WH6862> and shall break <WH1633> their bones, <WH6106> and pierce <WH4272> them through with his arrows. <WH2671>

He couched, <WH3766> he lay <WH7901> down <WH7901> as a lion, <WH738> and as a great <WH3833> lion: <WH3833> who <WH4310> shall stir <WH6965> him up? Blessed <WH1288> is he that blesses <WH1288> you, and cursed <WH779> is he that curses <WH779> you.

And Balak's <WH1111> anger <WH639> was kindled <WH2734> against <WH413> Balaam, <WH1109> and he smote <WH5606> his hands <WH3709> together: and Balak <WH1111> said <WH559> to Balaam, <WH1109> I called <WH7121> you to curse <WH6895> my enemies, <WH341> and, behold, <WH2009> you have altogether blessed <WH1288> them these <WH2088> three <WH7969> times.

Therefore now <WH6258> flee <WH1272> you to your place: <WH4725> I thought <WH559> to promote <WH3513> you to great honor; <WH3513> but, see, <WH2009> the LORD <WH3068> has kept <WH4513> you back <WH4513> from honor. <WH3519>
And Balaam <WH1109> said <WH559> to Balak, <WH1111> Spoke <WH1696> I not also <WH1571> to your messengers <WH4397> which <WH834> you sent <WH7971> to me, saying, <WH559>

If <WH518> Balak <WH1111> would give <WH5414> me his house <WH1004> full <WH4393> of silver <WH3701> and gold, <WH2091> I cannot <WH3808> <WH3201> go <WH5674> beyond <WH5674> the commandment <WH6310> of the LORD, <WH3068> to do <WH6213> either good <WH2896> or <WH176> bad <WH7451> of my own mind; <WH3820> but what <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> said, <WH1696> that will I speak? <WH1696>

And now, <WH6258> behold, <WH2005> I go <WH1980> to my people: <WH5971> come <WH3212> therefore, and I will advertise <WH3289> you what <WH834> this <WH2088> people <WH5971> shall do <WH6213> to your people <WH5971> in the latter <WH319> days. <WH3117>

And he took <WH5375> up his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559> Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> has said, <WH5002> and the man <WH1397> whose eyes <WH5869> are open <WH8365> has said: <WH5002>

He has said, <WH5002> which heard <WH8085> the words <WH561> of God, <WH410> and knew <WH3045> the knowledge <WH1847> of the most <WH6944> High, <WH5945> which saw <WH2372> the vision <WH4236> of the Almighty, <WH7706> falling <WH5307> into a trance, but having his eyes <WH5869> open: <WH1540>

I shall see <WH7200> him, but not now: <WH6258> I shall behold <WH7789> him, but not near: <WH7126> there shall come <WH1869> a Star <WH3556> out of Jacob, <WH3290> and a Scepter <WH7626> shall rise <WH6965> out of Israel, <WH3478> and shall smite <WH4272> the corners <WH6285> of Moab, <WH4124> and destroy <WH6979> all <WH3605> the children <WH1121> of Sheth. <WH8352>
And Edom <WH123> shall be a possession, <WH3424> Seir <WH8165> also shall be a possession <WH3424> for his enemies; <WH341> and Israel <WH3478> shall do <WH6213> valiantly. <WH2428>
Out of Jacob <WH3290> shall come <WH3381> he that shall have dominion, <WH7287> and shall destroy <WH6> him that remains <WH8300> of the city. <WH5892>

And when he looked <WH7200> on <WH5921> Amalek, <WH6002> he took <WH5375> up his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559> Amalek <WH6002> was the first <WH7225> of the nations; <WH1471> but his latter <WH319> end shall be that he perish <WH8> for ever. <WH5703>

And he looked <WH7200> on <WH5921> the Kenites, <WH7017> and took <WH5375> up his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559> Strong <WH386> is your dwelling place, <WH4186> and you put <WH7760> your nest <WH7064> in a rock. <WH5553>
Nevertheless <WH3588> <WH518> the Kenite <WH7014> shall be wasted, <WH1197> until <WH5704> Asshur <WH804> shall carry <WH7617> you away captive. <WH7617>
And he took <WH5375> up his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559> Alas, <WH188> who <WH4310> shall live <WH2421> when God <WH410> does <WH7760> this!

And ships <WH6716> shall come from the coast <WH3027> of Chittim, <WH3794> and shall afflict <WH6031> Asshur, <WH804> and shall afflict <WH6031> Eber, <WH5677> and he also <WH1571> shall perish <WH8> for ever. <WH5703>
And Balaam <WH1109> rose <WH6965> up, and went <WH3212> and returned <WH7725> to his place: <WH4725> and Balak <WH1111> also <WH1571> went <WH1980> his way. <WH1870>
